marklogic.body: What a crock. Noses can break without severe Bleeding. And, Mr. ER Dr., you should know that blood is a fluid that does not necessarily get on clothes, anymore than any other fluid. Clothes are not a magnet for blood. If blood on clothing was a requisite of having a broken nose, then that's the first thing you guys would check... does he have a bloody shirt? NO? His nose is fine. A towel covered in blood? What about his shirt? If his shirt is dry, his nose is fine. When an ENT does corrective surgery, do they throw away the patient's shirt? I broke my nose twice, it didn't Bleed either time. I'm sure all the "nose must Bleed" conspiracy theorists will dispute my account, but I assure you, broken bones do not Always discharge blood on the outside of one's body!
